content: Hello, this is Sarah calling from Ali's Organization. I'm calling to collect some information for your upcoming Initial Consultation with Dr. Jane Smith on 07/25/2025 at 06:38 PM. Is this a good time to talk for a few minutes?
Yes. It's a good time. So let's stop.

Great! Let me ask you a few questions to help prepare for your appointment.

First, Ali Raza, can you tell me what brought you in today?
I have a severe headache to the right side of my head.
Okay, I understand. So, how would you describe your main symptom, and when did it start?
It's like, I will you know, it's like a hard it
at the early morning, and
increasing with the increasing of the screen timing.

Okay, Ali Raza, I understand. It's a hard headache that started in the early morning and increases with screen time.

Now, walk me through how this problem has changed since it began. What makes it better or worse?
Like, I told you on increasing the screen timing and
like, taking a long sleeve.

Okay, so it gets worse with increased screen time, and better with sleep. Thanks for clarifying that, Ali Raza.

Is there anything else you think I should know that we haven’t covered yet about the headache?
Sorry. Please ask again.
No problem at all, Ali Raza. Is there anything else you think I should know about the headache that we haven’t covered yet? Anything at all that might be relevant?
No.
Okay, thank you. Now, do you have any allergies to medications, foods, or other substances?
Yes. I have from, you know, or, like, a
a heart or, you know,
a heart smell, like a perfume.
Okay, Ali Raza, so you have an allergy to a certain perfume scent. Just to confirm, is it a specific perfume or a type of scent? And do you know what kind of reaction you have?
Hello?

Yes, Ali Raza, I'm here. Sorry for the brief pause. I was just noting down your allergy. To clarify, is it a specific perfume brand or a type of scent that you're allergic to? And what kind of reaction do you experience?
Like, when I am, you know,
wear the perfume, I'm, like,
like, you know, type smell. Uh-huh. So that one caused
creating the headache and getting it worse.

Okay, I understand. So when you're exposed to that perfume scent, it causes a headache and makes it worse. Thank you for clarifying, Ali Raza.

Based on what you understand so far, what outcomes or next steps are you hoping for from today’s visit with Dr. Jane Smith on 07/25/2025?
Yes.
Could you tell me what you're hoping to get out of the appointment with Dr. Smith? What outcomes or next steps are you hoping for?
I want Dr. Smith to figure out what is causing these headaches and give me a plan to stop them, whether that is medicine or tests to check my eyes or brain.

Got it—you're hoping for a clear diagnosis and a treatment plan, possibly with medication or further testing. Thank you.

Next, I'd like to ask a few questions about your family history. Are there any medical conditions that run in your immediate family, like migraines, high blood pressure, diabetes, or heart disease?
My mother gets migraines sometimes, and my father has high blood pressure. No other major issues that I know of.
Thank you. Now for your own medical history—have you ever been diagnosed with any chronic conditions, had surgeries, or hospitalizations?
No chronic illnesses and no surgeries. I only had a hospital visit last year for dehydration, but I recovered quickly.
Understood. Are you taking any medications right now, including prescriptions, over-the-counter medicines, vitamins, or herbal supplements?
I take ibuprofen 400 milligrams when the headache is really bad, maybe twice a week. No other medicines or supplements.
Thanks for letting me know. I’d like to review other body systems briefly. Besides the headache, have you noticed any other symptoms like vision changes, nausea, fever, weakness, or sleep problems?
I get a little light sensitivity and sometimes mild nausea when the headache peaks. No fever, weakness, or sleep issues.
Thank you. Now for your social history—can you tell me about your work, living situation, and any habits like tobacco, alcohol, or recreational drugs?
I live with my wife and work as a software engineer, so I’m on the computer most of the day. I don’t smoke or use drugs. I drink coffee twice a day and only have alcohol on special occasions.
Thanks for sharing. Lastly, have you checked any vital signs recently—like blood pressure, pulse, temperature, or weight? If so, do you remember the readings?
I checked at a pharmacy last week: blood pressure was 120 over 78, pulse was 72, and I didn’t have a fever. My weight is about 160 pounds.

Perfect, thank you for all that information, Ali Raza. I’ll pass everything along to Dr. Smith so she’s ready for your visit on July 25th.

Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like the doctor to know or any questions for me?
No, that covers everything. Thanks for calling.
You’re welcome! We look forward to seeing you then. Have a great day and feel better soon.
